figure_1.title: Figure 1.
figure_1.caption:
Estimated Marginal Means with 95% Bootstrap Confidence Intervals for the Significant Moderation of Treatment Effects on Criminal Thinking
Note. MRT = moral reconation therapy; UC = usual care; PICTS = Psychological Inventory of Criminal Thinking Scale.

figure_2.title: Figure 2.
figure_2.caption:
Estimated Marginal Means with 95% Bootstrap Confidence Intervals for the Significant Moderation of Treatment Effects on Number of Criminal Associates
Note. MRT = moral reconation therapy; UC = usual care; MCAA = Measures of Criminal Attitudes and Associates.

figure_3.title: Figure 3.
figure_3.caption:
Estimated Marginal Means with 95% Bootstrap Confidence Intervals for the Significant Moderation of Treatment Effects on Employment Problem Severity
Note. MRT = moral reconation therapy; UC = usual care; ASI = Addiction Severity Index.

claims.sentence:
Treatment condition coded as MRT = 1, UC = 0, where MRT = moral reconation therapy and UC = usual care; TriPM = Triarchic Psychopathy Measure; PICTS = Psychological Inventory of Criminal Thinking Scale; MCAA = Measures of Criminal Attitudes and Associates; CI = confidence interval.

aEffect sizes for continuous outcomes are standardized mean differences (i.e., Cohen’s d), calculated from the results of linear mixed effect models and the standard deviation of the outcome at baseline.


bEffect sizes for count outcomes are incidence rate ratios (IRRs), calculated from results of Poisson generalized linear mixed effect models.


*p < .05;


**p < .01;


***p < .001

Figure 1.
MRT = moral reconation therapy; UC = usual care; PICTS = Psychological Inventory of Criminal Thinking Scale.Figure 2.

Treatment condition coded as MRT = 1, UC = 0, where MRT = moral reconation therapy and UC = usual care; TriPM = Triarchic Psychopathy Measure; ASI = Addiction Severity Index; TLFB = timeline follow back; CI = confidence interval.

aEffect sizes for continuous outcomes are standardized mean differences (i.e., Cohen’s d), calculated from the results of linear mixed effect models.


bEffect sizes for count outcomes are incidence rate ratios (IRRs), calculated from results of Poisson generalized linear mixed effect models.


*p < .05;


**p < .01;


***p < .001

Figure 3.
MRT = moral reconation therapy; UC = usual care; ASI = Addiction Severity Index.Figure 5.
Future trials are still be warranted to further elucidate the subgroups for which MRT and other cognitive-behavioral interventions for criminogenic risk are most effective.Figure 4.
